text.p: Alberta's harvest was 80 percent complete compared to 75 percent done last week with another 10 days needed to finish combining, Alberta Agriculture said in a crop report for the week ended Oct 21.
"The Peace River region and the northern half of both the northwest and northeast regions are the areas with the most problems this harvest season," it said.
"For the rest of the province, over 80 percent of the crop has been harvested," it added.
Southern Alberta completed harvest except for a few acres of sugar beets in the Taber district.
Central Alberta was 75 to 85 percent harvested west to east with combining complete in the Oyen and Hanna districts.
Northeast Alberta reported harvest 80 to 85 percent of crops in the south, while the north had 40 to 50 percent of crops in the bin.
Northwest Alberta had harvested 80 percent of its crops in the south, 40 to 60 percent of its crop in the north.
The Peace River Valley saw little harvest progress in the past week. Between 35 to 40 percent of the crop was harvested.
